intro: Tabernaemontana glandulosa, commonly known as the fragrant star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of fragrant, star-shaped white flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is known for its strong, sweet scent, especially at night. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Tabernaemontana glandulosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and aromatic properties.
